newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish bonds rangebound in summer doldrums.
newsitem.headline: Danish bonds rangebound in summer doldrums.

text.p: Danish bond prices showed little movement on Wednesday, ignoring lower than expected U.S. CPI data to close virtually unchanged from Tuesday.
The outgoing benchmark eight percent state bond due 2006 finished unchanged at 113.43, yielding 5,96 percent, in thin, summer turnover of 565 million crowns.
Its successor, the seven percent 2007 bond was 0.05 point up, at 106.21, yielding 6.16 percent, in turnover of 860 million crowns and with a spread to the 10-year bund of 55 basis points.
The 2006 bond's September future climbed 0.46 point to 113.06.
The six percent mortgage-backed bond maturing in 2026 rose 0.02 point to 91.75.
The crown strengthened slightly, to 3.8113 to the mark from an earlier 3.8120.

Dealers expected little activity on Thursday, with the strong dollar continuing to depress German bunds and the effect spilling over onto the Danish market. --Steve Weizman, Copenhagen newsroom + 45 33969650
